title: Sectional Mock 1 - English
instruction: In the following passage, some of the words/sentences have been left out, each of which is indicated by a letter. Find the suitable word/sentence from the options given against each letter and fill up the blanks with appropriate words/sentences to make the paragraph meaningful."The first thing you ____ A ____ , if you look at a map, is that the Arctic — unlike the Antarctic — is an ocean surrounded by continents," Alastair Fraser, a geoscientist from Imperial College London, told Live Science. Firstly, this means there's a huge quantity of ____ B ____ material available, in the form of dead sea creatures such as plankton and algae, which form the basis of what will ____ C ____ become oil and gas. Secondly, the surrounding ring of continents means that the Arctic Basin contains a high proportion of continental crust, which makes up about 50% of its oceanic area, Fraser explained. That's significant because continental crust — as ____ D ____ to ocean crust, which makes up the rest of the area — typically contains deep depressions called basins, into which organic matter sinks, he said.

quiz.text: Which among the following is correct regarding the opinion of Russia and China on the sanction imposed by USA on Iran?
options: Russia is against the sanctions imposed by the USA but China does not want to show that it is going against US ban.
Russia and China both support the sanctions imposed by USA on Iran regarding its trade relations with other countries.
US and China both support Russia but Russia is in favour of Iran on the issue of trade sanctions by the USA.
China and Russia have no say regarding the sanctions imposed by the USA on Iran regarding its trade relations with other countries.
Russia and China support the trade relations of Iran with other countries and they are completely against any kind of sanction by USA.

quiz.text: Which among the following is NOT a country that is expected to give a headache to the new External Affairs Minister of India, S Jaishankar, as described in the passage?
options: USA
Russia
China
Bulgaria
All the above are going to be causes of concern for India

quiz.text: Which among the following is NOT correct regarding the GSP status granted to India by the USA regarding trade relations between the countries?
options: USA has recently withdrawn the GSP status granted to India regarding its trade relations with the USA.
USA granted the GSP status to India more than two decades ago to show that both are trade partners.
USA not granted GSP status to any other country in the world except India due to the fact that India is its favoured ally.
Both A and C
All A, B and C

quiz.text: Which of the following is synonymous to the word STARK as mentioned in the passage?
options: Benign
Austere
Gentle
Non-intimidating
None of these

quiz.text: What can be the antonym of COLLISION as used in the passage?
options: Lambasting
Eluding
Pounding
Pummelling
None of these

quiz.text: Choose the word/group of words which is MOST SIMILAR in meaning to the word REVIVE as used in the passage.
options: rekindle
extinguish
quench
developed
none of these

quiz.text: Which among the following has / have dictated the decision of the USA to ban Huawei from its territory?
options: USA does not want Huawei to make profits from its territory whereas USA manufacturers are not able to do anything.
USA does not want to take the chance that foreign manufacturers control the USA market completely instead of the indigenous mobile manufacturers.
USA is in no way related to Huawei and that is why there is no chance that China will attack USA.
USA thinks that cyber-security and Intellectual Property Rights issues are not safely handled by Huawei.
None of the above

quiz.text: Match the columns.
options: Only A-E
Only B-F
Only C-D, B-F
Only A-E, C-D
None of the above

quiz.text: Match the columns.
options: Only A-E
Only B-F
Only C-D, B-F
Only A-E, C-D
None of the above

quiz.text: Match the columns.
options: Only A-F
Only B-D
Only A-F, C-E
Only B-D, C-E
None of the above

quiz.text: Match the columns.
options: Only B-D
Only B-D, A-E
Only A-E
Only A-E, C-F
None of the above

quiz.text: A comedian analyzes the mundane from a variety of angles and “find the thread among two points.”
options: found the threading between two points
finds the thread between two points
finding the thread among two points
is finding the thread between more than two points
No improvement required

quiz.text: A federal government climate-change report released last year shows the Pacific Northwest is already “seeing damage from rising temperatures.”
options: seen damages for rising temperatures
seeing damaging for rising temperatures
seen damaging from rising temperatures
seeing damaging from rising temperatures
No improvement required

quiz.text: “Getting to hire” as the assistant to a pastry chef seemed like a dream come true.
options: Get to hire
Getting to be hired
Getting hired

Having got hired

E
No improvement required

quiz.text: The days when inflation could topple governments appear to be gone. It is now time for the government to worry about falling prices, especially of food. Retail inflation dropped to a 17-month low of 2.33% in November, as compared to 3.31% in October, primarily due to the fall in the prices of various essential food items.Which among the following can be inferred from the above passage?
options: The government should not leave inflation at the hands of the RBI in order to take all the calls regarding the set of its target.
The government should understand that the RBI is the main organization to control the autonomy and economy of the inflation targeting framework of the country.
The situations of the economy in the past and the present have changed completely with respect to the governance of economy in the country.
The government does not have any response to the falling inflation rates in the country though others would have jumped at it.
None of these

quiz.text: Which among the following can be said regarding the style of writing in the given passage above?
options: Political
Commentary
Explanatory
Excruciating
None of these

quiz.text: Which among the following can be said about Mr. Urjit Patel’s character from the given passage?
options: Autocratic
Synthetic
Apathetic
Functional
None of these

quiz.text: Which among the following can explain the road lying ahead for the British Prime Minister Theresa May in the Brexit front?
options: Rambunctious
Restrained
Scurrilous
Opprobrious
All are correct

quiz.text: Both the Centre and States must ____________ on ending the special treatment for sugar by letting market signals dictate crop prospects and prices. I. Bark up the wrong treeII. Burn the bridgesIII. Bite the bullet
options: Only II
Only III
Only I and II
Only II and III
None of the above

quiz.text: In the race to garner a larger share of the pie, the airlines seem to be ____________ in training, supervision and safety – adopting a grow-now-fix-later attitude.I. cutting cornersII. All earsIII. Call a spade a spade
options: Only I
Only II
Only I & III
Only III
Only II and III

quiz.text: In this generally upbeat environment, hardly any analyst wants to ____________ and state in a research report that the excitement about the rupee depreciation is overdone as far as IT stocks are concerned.I. Put their necks on the lineII. Go out on a limbIII. Stick their necks out
options: Only II
Only III
Only I and II
Only I and III
All are correct

quiz.text: We’re taught that evolution is all about “survival of the fittest” but sometimes evolution can be the result of a lucky animal ____________.I. Cherry pickingII. Arguing the tossIII. Finding any port in a storm
options: Only I
Only I and III
Only II
Only II and III
Only III

quiz.text: Boisterous
options: Rowdy: Adversity
Calumny: Aspersion
Captivating: Desist
Clamorous: Placid
None of the above

quiz.text: Contrary
options: Earthly: Fleshly
Blunt: Evasive
Dissimilar: Conflicting
Generic: Liberal
None of the above

quiz.text: Deciphera] Introvert: Intentional
options: Interpret: Distort
Mocking: Taunting
Rash: Sudden
None of the above

quiz.text: Efface
options: Destroy: Obliterate
Undertake: Aspire
Conspire: Utilize
Secure: Plant
Construct: Demur

quiz.text: A
options: realize
endeavour
associate
intend
pretend

utility
